DOC.brief_summary: This study compares the efficacy of embedding avatars into an online self-management program that teaches OAB behavioral therapy on OAB-related quality of life, symptoms, self-efficacy, and adherence versus the same program without avatars
DOC.brief_title: Virtual Avatar Coaches for Behavioral Therapy of Patients With Overactive Bladder
DOC.criteria: age 55 or older women living in the community who could read and speak English urgency (≥3 episodes/24 hrs.) ± urge urinary incontinence urinary frequency (≥8 times/24 hrs.) nocturia (awakening ≥2 times at night) hematuria abdominal pain fever cognitive impairment (MiniCog < 3) positive screen for depression (PHQ2 > 3) hearing issues uncorrected visual difficulties
